item.title: Gold Rate And Silver Price Today on January 19, 2025: Check latest Rates in India - Mint
item.description:
Gold Rate And Silver Price Today on January 19, 2025

Date: January 19, 2025 | Source: Live Mint

Gold prices experienced a modest decrease today in India. The cost of 24 carat gold is Rs.8128.3 per gram, while 22 carat gold is Rs.7452.3 per gram. Silver is priced at Rs.99600.0 per kg.

  • 24 carat gold: ₹8128.3 per gram (down ₹170.0)
  • 22 carat gold: ₹7452.3 per gram (down ₹160.0)
  • Silver: ₹99600.0 per kg (down ₹100.0)
"Gold Rate Today in Chennai is ₹81131.0/10 grams, reflecting increases in previous days..."

Market fluctuations in gold and silver are influenced by various factors, including global demand, currency fluctuations, and interest rates.

item.title: New Tata Harrier Rival Landed At Auto Expo! - MotorOctane
item.description:
New BYD Sealion 6 Unveiled at Auto Expo

Date: January 2025 | Source: MotorOctane

BYD has introduced the Sealion 6, its first internal combustion engine model in the country, at the Auto Expo. This SUV features an array of advanced technologies and safety options.

  • Equipped with C-shaped headlights and 19-inch alloy wheels.
  • Interior includes a 15.6-inch touchscreen, 12.3-inch digital display, and 10-speaker audio system.
  • Offers a 1.5-litre plug-in hybrid engine with options for FWD and AWD.
  • Maximum power outputs: 214 bhp for FWD, 319 bhp for AWD.
  • Safety features include 7 airbags and a 360-degree camera system.
  • BYD has not confirmed a launch date for India yet, but it targets competition against Tata Harrier.
“If BYD also launches the Sealion 6, it will rival the likes of Tata Harrier in the country.”

In conclusion, the BYD Sealion 6 brings competitive features to the SUV market, potentially reshaping consumer choices in India.

item.title: Tata Avinya X unveiled at Bharat Mobility Expo 2025 - CarWale
item.description:
Tata Avinya X Unveiled at Bharat Mobility Expo 2025

Publication Date: 2025-01-12 Source: CarWale

Tata has introduced the Avinya X at the Bharat Mobility Expo 2025, showcasing a new ultra-luxury concept vehicle expected to launch in 2026.

  • Expected to arrive in EV guise.
  • Could be launched in 2026.
  • Redesigned from a coupe-like look to a more crossover-like design.
  • Features include a three-screen display, panoramic sunroof, and level-2 ADAS.
  • Estimated range of at least 500km, potentially with ICE options.
“The Avinya is Tata’s ultra-luxury foray and will leap into a price segment far above what Tata plays in right now.”

The Tata Avinya X represents a significant step forward for the brand into the ultra-luxury electric vehicle market, emphasizing innovation in design and technology.

item.title: Here Are All The EVs Launched And Showcased At The Auto Expo 2025 - CarDekho
item.description:
Bharat Mobility Global Expo 2025: All EVs Launched And Showcased At The Auto Expo 2025

Date: [Add publication date]
Source: CarDekho.com

The Bharat Mobility Global Expo 2025 showcased a range of electric vehicles (EVs) from various manufacturers, highlighting debut models, special editions, and innovative concepts.

  • Maruti unveiled the e-Vitara with a claimed range of over 500 km and two battery pack options.
  • Toyota presented the Urban Cruiser concept, a rebadged version of the e-Vitara.
  • Tata Motors launched several EVs, including the Harrier EV and Nexon EV Bandipur Edition.
  • Hyundai showcased the Creta Electric and Ioniq 9, with ranges of 473 km and 620 km respectively.
  • Mahindra introduced the XEV 9e SUV and BE 6 with ranges of 656 km and 682 km.
  • VinFast revealed multiple models, including the VF 3 and VF 6, targeting different segments.
  • BYD, MG, and Skoda also presented various EVs, indicating a growing market for electric mobility.
“The Bharat Mobility Global Expo 2025 has set a new benchmark for the EV industry in India.”

The expo highlights the rapid advancements in EV technology and the increasing commitment of manufacturers towards sustainable mobility solutions.

item.title: Trump, Q3 earnings among 9 factors that will steer D-Street this week - The Economic Times
item.description:
Trump, Q3 earnings among 9 factors that will steer D-Street this week

Publication Date: January 22, 2023 Source: The Economic Times

Indian benchmark indices faced selling pressure in IT and bank stocks, ending a two-session gaining streak. The week ahead is expected to see significant influences from various domestic and global events.

Key factors impacting the market this week include:

  • Trump Factor: With Donald Trump returning as the U.S. President, volatility is expected in global markets.
  • Q3 Earnings: Over 240 companies, including major players like HDFC Bank and Paytm, are announcing earnings.
  • US Markets: A strong closing on Wall Street signals a new regime under Trump.
  • FII/DII Action: Foreign institutional investors have been net sellers, impacting sentiments.
  • Technical Factors: Nifty remains in a bearish zone, indicating a persistent downward trend.
  • IPOs This Week: Four new IPOs, including three in the SME segment, are opening for subscription.
  • Rupee vs Dollar: The rupee remains stable against the dollar amid market volatility.
  • Crude Oil Prices: Fluctuating oil prices contribute to inflation concerns affecting markets.
  • Corporate Actions: Several companies are set to announce dividends and other corporate actions.
"Sentiment remains weak as the index declined after encountering resistance at a crucial moving average." - Rupak De, Senior Technical Analyst

These factors will be closely watched as the week unfolds, potentially steering market direction.

item.title: Stocks to Buy: As India awaits Budget, a few largecap, midcap, smallcap stocks analysts like for long term; note down targets - Zee Business
item.description:
Stocks to Buy Ahead of India's 2025-26 Budget: Analyst Recommendations

Publication Date: January 19, 2025 Source: Zee Business

As India anticipates its upcoming budget for 2025-26, analysts suggest various stocks across large-cap, mid-cap, and small-cap sectors that are deemed favorable for long-term investments. Here are some highlighted recommendations.

  • Angel One: Buy call with a target of Rs 3,200.
  • LTTS: Buy call with a target price of Rs 6,500.
  • Radico Khaitan: Buy call with a target of Rs 2,415.
  • DMart: Buy call with a target price of Rs 4,107.
  • Infosys: Buy rating with a target price of Rs 2,154.
  • HDFC Life Insurance: Buy call with a target of Rs 820.
  • Somany Ceramics: Buy call with a target price of Rs 680.
  • Stylam Industries: Buy rating with a target of Rs 3,525.
  • Century Plyboards: Buy call with a target price of Rs 890.
  • Nuvoco Vistas Corporation: Buy call with a target of Rs 420.
  • JK Lakshmi Cement: Buy call with a target of Rs 872.
As of January 17, the target for Somany Ceramics implies a potential upside of 16.8%.

Investors are encouraged to note these recommendations as they prepare for the budget announcements.

item.title: In calibrated move, RBI loosens grip, lets rupee depreciate against US dollar - The Indian Express
item.description:
RBI Allows Rupee to Depreciate Against US Dollar in Strategic Shift

Publication Date: January 13, 2024 | Source: The Indian Express

In a notable change, the Reserve Bank of India (RBI) has relaxed its stringent control over the rupee, permitting its depreciation against the US dollar.

The rupee experienced a significant single-day fall, hitting a historic low as market reactions to the RBI's new strategy unfold.

  • The rupee logged its biggest drop in nearly two years, falling to 86.70 against the dollar.
  • Since November 1, 2024, the rupee has depreciated by 2.6%.
  • This shift in strategy has been interpreted as a more flexible approach in currency management.
  • Experts caution it is too early to attribute this change solely to the new RBI Governor, Sanjay Malhotra.
  • The decline in reserves was accompanied by notable dollar sales to manage currency fluctuations.
“The RBI’s new approach is a prudent one. If you bind the rupee to a very tight range, you also end up spending a lot of energy and resources.”

In conclusion, the RBI's decision reflects a willingness to adapt to market conditions, potentially reshaping its long-term currency strategy.

item.title: Stocks to buy under ₹100: Sumeet Bagadia recommends 4 shares to buy on Monday - 20 January 2025 - Mint
item.description:
Stocks to buy under ₹100: Sumeet Bagadia recommends 4 shares to buy on Monday

Date: January 20, 2025

Source: Live Mint

After a three-session winning streak, the Nifty 50 index closed down by about half a percent, impacted by select banking and IT stocks. There has been significant foreign institutional investor sell-off in Indian equities this January, totaling over ₹46,500 crore.

Sumeet Bagadia's Stock Recommendations

Sumeet Bagadia, from Choice Broking, notes that the market sentiment is weak and suggests maintaining a stock-specific approach. He recommends purchasing stocks that show strong performance on technical charts.

Bagadia suggested the following stocks for investors to consider:

  • IRB Infrastructure Developers | Buy at ₹54.89 | Target price: ₹59 | Stop loss: ₹53
  • Sagardeep Alloys | Buy at ₹33.91 | Target price: ₹36.5 | Stop loss: ₹32.5
  • Medico Remedies | Buy at ₹65.52 | Target price: ₹70 | Stop loss: ₹63
  • Lloyds Engineering Works | Buy at ₹83.72 | Target price: ₹90 | Stop loss: ₹80
Bagadia noted, "Overall, the Indian stock market has a negative bias despite the Nifty 50 index closing above the 23,200 level."

Investors are advised to consult certified experts before making any investment decisions.

item.title: Madhusudan Kela Portfolio: Fresh Rs 965 cr investment in 2 stocks – One in a recently listed solar firm and another small-cap bet - ET Now
item.description:
Madhusudan Kela Portfolio: Fresh Rs 965 cr investment in 2 stocks – One in a recently listed solar firm and another small-cap bet

Updated: Jan 18, 2025 22:36 IST

Investor Madhusudan Kela has made significant investments worth Rs 965 crore in two stocks during the quarter ended December 31, 2024, boosting his portfolio to a total value of Rs 1,414.3 crore.

  • Kela has invested in Waaree Energies Limited, India's largest manufacturer of solar PV modules, purchasing 33,41,700 equity shares, a 1.16% stake for Rs 870.6 crore.
  • The shares of Waaree Energies debuted at a premium of 66.3% over their IPO price.
  • Kela's second investment is in Indostar Capital Finance Ltd, acquiring about 3,379,834 shares representing a 2.48% stake, valued at Rs 94.5 crore.
“Shares of Indostar Capital Finance Ltd. have given a return of 38.97% in the past year.”

This latest move reflects Kela's strategic focus on the renewable energy sector and small-cap investments.

item.title: Narayana Murthy’s family wealth takes a ₹1,850-crore hit as Infosys shares plunge 6% - Mint
item.description:
Narayana Murthy’s Family Wealth Takes a ₹1,850-Crore Hit as Infosys Shares Plunge 6%

Date: Not specified Source: LiveMint

Infosys Ltd co-founder NR Narayana Murthy’s family wealth suffered a loss of ₹1,850 crore due to a nearly 6 percent decline in share price of India's second largest IT services company on Friday.

  • The Murthy family's stake in Infosys is now valued at about ₹30,300 crore, down from ₹32,152 crore.
  • The family owns a combined 4.02 percent stake in Infosys, with individual holdings including Narayana Murthy (0.40%), Sudha Murty (0.92%), Rohan Murty (1.62%), and Akshata Murty (1.04%).
  • The Infosys share price declined by 5.77% to ₹1,815.10 on BSE, impacting broader market indices.
  • Despite the decline, Infosys reported an 11.46% rise in net profit in Q3, raised its revenue growth forecast, and cited increased demand in financial services and retail sectors.
“What we are seeing is a clear change in the discretionary activity in financial services, in retail and consumer products, which gives us good confidence.” - Salil Parekh, CEO of Infosys

In conclusion, the Murthy family's wealth has been significantly affected by the recent drop in Infosys' stock price despite the company’s strong earnings report.

item.title: Nifty 50, Nifty 500: Deep dive into the current market correction - BusinessLine
item.description:
Market Correction Analysis: Nifty 50 and Nifty 500 Insights

Date: January 19, 2025 | Source: The Hindu Business Line

This article discusses the recent market correction affecting the Nifty 50 and Nifty 500 indices, highlighting performance disparities across different stocks and sectors.

  • The Nifty 50 has declined 12% from its all-time high of 26,216.
  • The bottom quartile of Nifty-500 stocks lost an average of 26%, while the top quartile gained 8%.
  • Factors influencing the market include US rate cuts, China stimulus, and India Inc earnings slowdown.
  • Different sectors experienced varied impacts: IT and Pharma performed relatively well, while FMCG and automotive sectors struggled.
  • High-debt stocks faced significant declines, while stocks with high PE ratios fared better.
“The wave of correction was felt differently across sectors and companies.”

The overall analysis suggests that while some sectors and stocks provide opportunities for growth, others are adversely affected, emphasizing the importance for investors to assess risks and seek safety in this volatile market.

item.title: Stock Market Next Week: Trump’s swearing-in ceremony, Nifty weekly expiry, IREDA fund raise among key cues to watch - ET Now
item.description:
Stock Market Next Week: Key Cues to Watch Including Trump's Swearing-In Ceremony

Updated: January 18, 2025, Source: ET NOW

The Indian equity market is expected to remain cautious in the upcoming week following persistent selling by FIIs and mixed corporate earnings. Key events include the swearing-in ceremony of Donald Trump and the Nifty weekly expiry.

  • The Indian equity market continued a consolidation phase with selling pressure and a rise in crude oil prices.
  • Experts predict a cautious market tone due to domestic and global factors.
  • Nifty will test the 22,700 level, with support at 22,900.
“The swearing-in ceremony of Donald Trump on January 20 is expected to draw significant attention, especially for any initial announcements on trade tariffs.” - Ajit, Religare

Several corporate actions, global economic indicators, and events such as HSBC PMI and consumer confidence reports will be watched closely next week.

item.title: $TRUMP meme coin rakes in billions ahead of Donald Trump’s inauguration, spikes over 300% within hours after launch - Mint
item.description:
$TRUMP Meme Coin Surges 300% on Launch Ahead of Trump's Inauguration

Publication Date: January 18, 2025 | Source: Live Mint

The cryptocurrency market saw an explosive rally with the launch of the $TRUMP meme coin, which experienced a surge of over 300% just hours after its debut.

  • The $TRUMP meme coin debuted with a market capitalization of $14.5 billion.
  • Trading volumes exceeded $1 billion shortly after launch.
  • Price rose from an initial $0.18 to $7.1 shortly after.
  • Donald Trump introduced the coin on social media, inviting investors to join his community.
  • The coin was developed on the Solana blockchain with an initial supply of 200 million tokens.
"My NEW Official Trump Meme is HERE! It’s time to celebrate everything we stand for: WINNING! Join my very special Trump Community. GET YOUR $TRUMP NOW. Go to http://gettrumpmemes.com — Have Fun!" — Donald J. Trump

This launch highlights the significant interest in cryptocurrency driven by political events and figures.

item.title: $TRUMP meme coin skyrockets 300% in under three hours on explosive debut ahead of Donald Trump’s inauguration - Mint
item.description:
$TRUMP meme coin rakes in billions ahead of Donald Trump’s inauguration; spikes massive 300% within hours after launch

Publication Date: Not specified Source: Live Mint

Donald Trump launched the $TRUMP meme coin days before his inauguration, achieving an $8 billion market cap and a 300% increase in value shortly after launch.

  • The $TRUMP coin surged to a price of $7.1 from an initial $0.18.
  • Trading volumes approached $1 billion in under three hours.
  • Trump marketed the coin as his “official Trump meme” through posts on X and Truth Social.
  • The coin experienced a rapid rise, hitting a peak market cap of $7.7 billion shortly after launch.
  • 200 million tokens were created for the launch, with plans for a total supply of 1 billion over three years.
“My NEW Official Trump Meme is HERE! It's time to celebrate everything we stand for: WINNING!”

The rapid success of the $TRUMP token reflects significant interest in cryptocurrency and meme coins, particularly tied to pop culture figures.

item.title: Donald Trump's new $TRUMP meme coin records 220% increase within hours - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Donald Trump's $TRUMP Meme Coin Sees 220% Surge in Hours

Date: January 18, 2025 | Source: Hindustan Times

Ahead of his inauguration, Donald Trump has launched a new meme coin, $TRUMP, causing a stir in the cryptocurrency market.

  • The token was launched on the Solana network and aimed to engage Trump's supporter base on social media.
  • The $TRUMP coin's market cap soared by 220%, reaching $4.25 billion shortly after its launch.
  • Trading volumes for the coin approached $1 billion; it shot up from an initial price of $0.18 to $7.1.
  • Trump has expressed intentions to implement cryptocurrency-friendly policies during his upcoming term.
“It’s time to celebrate everything we stand for: WINNING! Join my very special Trump Community. GET YOUR $TRUMP NOW.” - Donald Trump

This launch has sparked significant interest in cryptocurrency ahead of Trump's second term, potentially indicating upcoming regulation changes.

item.title: Did PM Modi say India sells 2.5 crore cars annually? How misreporting of his speech at Bharat Mobility Global Expo triggered outrage - OpIndia
item.description:
Did PM Modi say India sells 2.5 crore cars annually? How misreporting of his speech at Bharat Mobility Global Expo triggered outrage

Publication Date: January 18, 2025 | Source: OpIndia

On January 17, PM Modi inaugurated the Bharat Mobility Global Expo, discussing India’s vehicle manufacturing growth and emphasizing the sale of 2.5 crore vehicles. Following his speech, misreporting led to online outrage over the claim that he implied India's sale consisted solely of cars.

  • PM Modi highlighted India’s achievements in vehicle sales, asserting sales surpassing 2.5 crore annually.
  • Misinterpreted quotes circulated claiming he said "cars" rather than "vehicles".
  • Social media backlash included political attacks and misinformation about his statements.
  • Fact-checking revealed he referred to total vehicle sales including two-wheelers and other types.
  • Statista reported approximately 2.38 crore vehicles sold in the previous financial year.
“The population of many countries of the world is not as much as the number of vehicles being sold in India every year.” — PM Modi

The incident highlights the challenges of accurate media reporting and the rapid spread of misinformation online.

item.title: EPFO members can now change personal details, transfer EPF online without employers' intervention - Deccan Herald
item.description:
EPFO Members Can Change Details and Transfer EPF Online Without Employer Intervention

Published on: 18 January 2025, 13:07 IST

Over 7.6 crore EPFO members can now change personal details online and transfer EPF without employer intervention, thanks to a newly launched facility.

  • Members can change personal details like name and date of birth online without employer verification.
  • EPF transfer claims can now be filed online directly with Aadhaar OTP for those with e-KYC EPF accounts.
  • The new services aim to reduce grievances related to member profile/KYC issues.
  • Members can self-correct common errors without EPFO approval.
  • The processes are streamlined for both new and existing UAN holders.
  • Approximately 3.9 lakh pending cases will now benefit from the simplification.
“The simplification would provide relief to employees in 45 per cent of cases.”

The changes are designed to enhance the efficiency of EPFO services, reducing processing times and improving the user experience for members.

item.title: Sales of homes, costing below ₹50 lakh, decline 14 pc in 2024 to 38,626 units in 7 cities: JLL - Mint
item.description:
Sales of Homes Below ₹50 Lakh Decline by 14% in 2024: JLL Report

Publication Date: January 16, 2024

Source: PTI

The sales of affordable apartments in seven major Indian cities have fallen by 14% in 2024, reaching 38,626 units.

  • The drop is attributed to fewer launches of affordable housing projects and rising prices.
  • Overall apartment sales in these cities increased to 302,867 units, marking an 11% growth from 271,818 units.
  • The seven cities analyzed include Mumbai, Delhi-NCR, Bengaluru, Pune, Chennai, Hyderabad, and Kolkata.
  • Sales in the ₹50 lakh–1 crore category remained stable.
  • Strong demand was noted for apartments priced above ₹1 crore.
“The housing market is expected to exhibit strong performance amid rising urbanization levels and higher demand for premium homes.”

In conclusion, while the market for lower-priced homes shows decline, segments for pricier apartments are thriving, indicating shifting consumer preferences and economic conditions.
